intro: Conostylis psammophila, commonly known as the sandhill everlasting, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Poaceae, commonly known as the grass family. This species is characterized by its tufted growth habit and small, fluffy inflorescences that resemble cotton balls. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in coastal or inland dune environments. The plant is adapted to withstand arid conditions and is an important component of native vegetation in its habitat.
